page.title: 11MASSEY'S FOLLY
page.content: In the later part of the 19th. century William Massey became rector of Farringdon. He designed an elaborate building and then personally employed two men for over 20 years to construct it.In 1903 the Revd. Massey ran out of money, the inside of the towers still incomplete. A few years later the building was used as a private boarding school for girls. During W.W. 2 hay was stored in the folly! Today it is the village hall,run by volunteers, and one part is the village primary school. Many people consider the building to be completely out of keeping with the rest of the buildings.
